workLog.result: Found that commit-limit-bypass label was added at 19:35:23Z, 9 minutes after workflow failed at 19:26:23Z

workLog.action: Triggered new workflow run by closing and reopening PR #955
workLog.result: New workflow run (21078538292) started at 19:36:44Z with bypass label present
PR Validation check passed with conclusion: success

workLog.action: Created session log documenting the fix

deliverables.description: Session log documenting PR #955 workflow fix

decisions.decision: Close and reopen PR to trigger workflow
decisions.rationale: Simplest way to trigger pull_request event with bypass label already present
decisions.impact: Workflow re-ran with bypass label and passed validation

technical_insights.insight: GitHub workflow label checks are point-in-time snapshots
technical_insights.evidence: Workflow fetched labels at start, did not see bypass label added 9 minutes after failure
technical_insights.implications: Labels must be present BEFORE workflow run, not added during or after

nextSteps: PR #955 is now unblocked and can proceed with merge once all other checks pass
Consider adding workflow retry mechanism for label changes
summary: Fixed PR #955 validation failure by triggering a new workflow run after the commit-limit-bypass label was added. The PR has 86 commits (exceeding the 20-commit limit), but the bypass label now allows it to pass validation. The workflow enforcement logic correctly checks for the bypass label and allows the PR to proceed when present.
